column4: my system gets stuck on boot when it saying mounting the root filesystem and it does not do anything for 10'. any ideas how to solve this thing ?
make the root partition about 3g  rather than 200g  in size ?
what kind of answer is this? i cannot even boot on my system and i have data on it. and it is auto partitioned the way the installer did it.
you can not boot ?
no
what did you upgrade that cause the inabilty to boot msid ?
i just did a fresh installation. and it doesn't work
the you don't have data on the root system in the sense of valuable files that need to be saved.    you did a fresh install and it wont boot.   reinstall it.  and use expert mode.
i have data, it worked until i rebooted it for the first time
then again i ask what you changed (between the time it booted correctly and the time it failed to boot)  ?
if a system boots one time and the next time it doesn't,  something changed.
yes, data got on the hard drive. isn't that unusual now ?
what data ?
MY data
a file called vmlinux perhaps ?
word documents, mp3, videos
none of the will affect the system.    what else did you change ?
i am not in the mood to play with words man. i say it for the last time, NOTHING
then it will still boot.
it doesn't

i'm in no mood to play either.  you havent described any problem you just said "it will not boot... after i rebooted"   thus it did boot.  but now doesn't  unless you can give us some error message to work with, or remember what you changed that might have caused it.  i can not help.
there are only two things that cause a system to "stop" booting.  software change  or hardware failure.
